messages.title: Is there anything I can help you with?

messages.speech: In England, you do not need to arrange a survey, but it is likely that the buyer will, and so a surveyor will arrange an appointment to visit your home. The five key things a surveyor will be looking for are problems with utilities, damp, cracking, problems with roofs, and timber defects. In addition, your buyerâ€™s mortgage lender will organize a mortgage valuation to confirm that the property is worth the money being leaned.
